Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk openssl
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: openssl bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols, as well as a full-strength general-purpose cryptography library. This update fixes the following bugs: In Transport Layer Security (TLS) client applications that use Secure Sockets Layer version 2 (SSLv2) ClientHello requests, the support for Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) based cipher suites was previously advertised, but the TLS extension giving the list of supported elliptic curves could not be sent. This caused a TLS connection to a server which used an elliptic curve not supported by the OpenSSL client to abort. With this update, the ECC-based cipher suites are not sent in the SSLv2 ClientHello request, and TLS connections are no longer aborted in the aforementioned scenario. (BZ#1090955) Previously, the Transport Layer Security (TLS) extensions that were sent in the Datagram TLS (DTLS) ClientHello requests did not contain the list of the supported elliptic curves. As a consequence, the DTLS connections to servers using elliptic curves not supported by the OpenSSL client were aborted. With this update, the elliptic curve list extension is properly sent in the DTLS ClientHello requests, and DTLS connections are no longer aborted in the above circumstances. (BZ#1119803) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: In order to enhance performance of various cryptographic algorithms in the OpenSSL library, the IBM Power Systems assembly language code in OpenSSL has been updated. Now, on current IBM Power processors, the performance of OpenSSL has significantly improved. (BZ#913657) The updated openssl packages contain various changes to allow for FIPS mode 140-2 validation of the Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenSSL FIPS module. (BZ#1073914) In the previous openssl packages, the curve that Transport Layer Security (TLS) server supports had to be selected before the TLS connection was accepted. With this update, the server can now automatically choose a curve from the list of curves supported by the client. However, this needs to be enabled by an API call in the relevant TLS server implementation. (BZ#1080128) The Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap support according to RFC 5649 has been added to the high level encryption EVP API. (BZ#1119738) Users of openssl are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. For the update to take effect, all services linked to the OpenSSL library must be restarted, or the system rebooted. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
